source.author: Barker, W.R.
source.title: Orobanchaceae

source.citation: From: Barker, W.R. (1999). Orobanchaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lateral calyx segments as broad as the corolla, entire; corolla glabrous except for small patches of glandular hairs, lobes obscurely crenate; anthers drying white, filaments glabrous; glandular hairs on inflorescence more or less appressed

Lateral calyx segments much narrower than corolla, usually bifid, rarely entire; corolla glandular-pubescent all over, lobes densely and irregularly toothed; anthers drying purple-black, filaments hairy in lower third; glandular hairs on inflorescence spreading
